pullRequest.body:
---
<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

For details on the "pull request lifecycle" in mathlib, please see:
https://leanprover-community.github.io/contribute/index.html

In particular, note that most reviewers will only notice your PR
if it passes the continuous integration checks.
Please ask for help on https://leanprover.zulipchat.com if needed.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Moves:
- Vector.* -> Mathlib.Vector.*
- ...

Deletions:
- Nat.bit1_add_bit1
- ...

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]

-->

[![Open in Gitpod](https://gitpod.io/button/open-in-gitpod.svg)](https://gitpod.io/from-referrer/)

---

<details><summary>

#### Declarations diff

</summary>

`+ sorted_le_range`
`+ sorted_lt_range`
`++ sort_range`
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>



</details>
ðŸš€ Pull request has been placed on the maintainer queue by YaelDillies.

I'm not sure what lemmas you're talking about. `sort (Â· â‰¤ Â·) l.reverse = sort (Â· â‰¤ Â·) l` and `(sort (Â· â‰¤ Â·) l).reverse = sort (Â· â‰¥ Â·) l` are both *false* in general, as e.g. if `x` and `y` are order equivalent, then `sort (Â· â‰¤ Â·) [x, y] = sort (Â· â‰¥ Â·) [x, y] = [x, y]` (recall merge-sort is a stable algorithm).

In any case, that seems quite out of scope for this PR.

Thanks! :tada:
bors merge

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/11653488499/job/32445920451)
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/11653488499/job/32445920310)

Thanks!

maintainer merge

Thanks, I think I had these in a branch somewhere.

It might be nice to have the ones about sorting in reverse order too, stated with `List.reverse`; up to you whether you want to declare those out of scope.

Thanks!

maintainer merge

Thanks, I think I had these in a branch somewhere.

It might be nice to have the ones about sorting in reverse order too, stated with `List.reverse`; up to you whether you want to declare those out of scope.
This should be `simp`
This doesn't work, as `simp` eagerly simplifies the LHS to `mergeSort (List.range n) = List.range n`. That feels like it shouldn't happen.
Actually, the issue might be the LHS is `List.range` rather than `Multiset.range`. I'll take a look.
This was indeed the issue, and has been fixed.
Could you add the `<` version here and throughout too?
The definition of `Multiset.sort` requires a total linear order, which `<` is not one of.

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat(Data/Finset/Sort): `sort (range n) = range n`

source.title: feat(Data/Finset & List): Add Lemmas for Sorting and Filtering
